abstract: Korean activist farmer Baek Nam-gi dies of injuries sustained while protesting rule of Pres Park Geun-hye in November 2015; doctors suspect cerebral hemorrhage that sent Baek into coma was caused by police water cannon at demonstration.
lead_paragraph: The activist, Baek Nam-gi, who had been expelled from school twice for protests against the dictator Park Chung-hee, was injured while opposing Mr. Park’s daughter, President Park Geun-hye.
snippet: The activist, Baek Nam-gi, who had been expelled from school twice for protests against the dictator Park Chung-hee, was injured while opposing Mr. Park’s daughter, President Park Geun-hye....

headline.main: Activist in South Korea Dies of Injuries From Police Water Cannon
headline.print_headline: Hit by Water Cannon in 2015, a South Korean Activist Dies
